name: Michael Burk
text:
It was decidedly fine. They've done a good job with social distancing and seem to be observing good precautions. The beer selection is more than adequate for a restaurant but disappointing for a place named "public house".

The house fries with sauces are a reasonable attempt at frites, but the fries came sans salt. They came with a mild chili-ketchup, aoili mayo, and a chipotle style sauce. The super salad was good, but did not differentiate itself from the dozens of similar salads.

The chicken and waffles looked nice but did not have the depth or heat hoped for. The crystal hot sauce was minimalistic. The corn dog looked to be dressed up but the acid was unbalanced with the other flavors making it more hippie than hipster.

Overall, it was very ok. We were hoping for a more "foodie" experience and were disappointed.

name: Lauren Rotman
text: Wanted to love this place as much as I love the downtown version but I just couldn’t. From the behavior of the hostesses to the bar tenders requiring IDs for each individual drink, this bar is a joke. Was saving a table while a friend bought my drink and she had to come get my ID to even order. What in the world? Who wants to wait 45 minute for a table? Don’t waste your time.

name: thomas cooper
text: Nice atmosphere, limited but tasty menu of foods. They have a number of specialty drinks. I tried a dirty martini which was watered down, costing them a star in my rating. Wait staff were attentive and friendly.

name: Rusty Sears
text: Great spot in the heart of Mountain Brook. Great food, great drinks, great service, great atmosphere. What more do you need?

name: John Wright
text: Good food, good drinks. Mountain Brook locale is awesome

name: Adrienne Campbell
text: The food was absolutely amazing. For an appetizer, we had the snack trio with the hummus and naan, stuffed peppadews, and olives. It was the perfect starter, the naan was super fresh and soft. For my entree, I chose the beet salad with grilled chicken. It was fresh, vibrant, and delicious! Can’t wait to dine here again.

name: James Feeley
text: First time here. We ate at the bar. Bartender/ mixologist Hunter was on point with his suggestions. The drink were unique and memorable. The brussel sprouts side was excellent. Kung Fu wings were very good. The shrimp salad was ok.

name: George William
text: Love the downtown Carrigan’s so I was anxious to try out their new branch campus. There are a few bugs to work out as far as infrastructure but this area is ripe for a place like Carrigans’s.

name: Shannon Dunn
text: Love the salads, drinks and atmosphere!

name: ML R
text: Food was amazing and the staff is great.
